alert.note: Alert for Northern Bristol; Northern Worcester; Southern Bristol; Southern Worcester; Western Norfolk (Massachusetts) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued July 13 at 4:06PM EDT by NWS Boston
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 11 PM EDT THIS EVENING THROUGH EARLY FRIDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of northern Connecticut, including the following area, Windham CT. Portions of Massachusetts, including the following areas, Northern Bristol MA, Northern Worcester MA, Southern Bristol MA, Southern Worcester MA and Western Norfolk MA. Portions of Rhode Island, including the following areas, Bristol RI, Eastern Kent RI, Newport RI, Northwest Providence RI, Southeast Providence RI, Washington RI and Western Kent RI. * WHEN...From 11 PM EDT this evening through early Friday morning. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas, which may impact the Friday morning commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Thunderstorms are expected to move in late tonight into the Watch area. Additional rounds of heavy showers and thunderstorms are possible later tonight and into the overnight hours. This may worsen or trigger new areas of flooding. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.

area.areaDesc: Northern Bristol; Northern Worcester; Southern Bristol; Southern Worcester; Western Norfolk
